summary: This is an email from an Assistant United States Attorney in the Southern District of New York providing an update on the investigation into Ghislaine Maxwell. The email states that a lawyer's client has agreed to cooperate with the investigation and prosecution of Maxwell, and that a meeting with the cooperating witness is being scheduled.

persons.name: Ghislaine Maxwell
persons.role: Subject of investigation and potential prosecution
persons.context: The document states the office is investigating and potentially prosecuting Ghislaine Maxwell.

persons.name: Assistant United States Attorney
persons.context: The author of the email, who is an AUSA in the Southern District of New York, is providing an update on the Maxwell investigation.

connections.description: The AUSA is part of the office investigating and potentially prosecuting Ghislaine Maxwell.

events.title: Cooperation Agreement Secured
events.description: An Assistant United States Attorney reports that a lawyer's client has agreed to cooperate with the investigation and potential prosecution of Ghislaine Maxwell.

locations.name: Southern District of New York
locations.context: The prosecuting office handling the investigation.

locations.name: One Saint Andrew's Plaza, New York, NY 10007
locations.context: The address of the U.S. Attorney's Office for the Southern District of New York.

keyFacts: A cooperating witness, represented by a lawyer, has agreed to assist in the investigation and potential prosecution of Ghislaine Maxwell as of December 9, 2019.
The cooperation involves topics that were previously 'off-limits' during prior meetings with the witness.
The prosecution team planned to schedule an interview with the cooperating witness within the next one to two weeks.
